audit_metadata.methodology: WCAG 2.1 Level AA + Assistive Technology Testing

severity_breakdown.critical: Application is completely unusable with screen readers and keyboard-only navigation in multiple key flows
severity_breakdown.high: Major barriers prevent completion of core game tasks for users with disabilities
severity_breakdown.medium: Significant usability issues that cause frustration and errors
severity_breakdown.low: Minor issues that impact experience but don't block functionality

most_critical_issues: Modals trap keyboard focus without Escape key functionality
Timer auto-submits with no way to pause for users needing extra time
Form inputs missing labels violate WCAG 1.3.1 and 3.3.2
Touch targets below 44x44px minimum throughout app
Dynamic content changes not announced to screen readers
Color-only information for game state (score positive/negative)

violations.user_scenario: Keyboard-only user trying to dismiss prediction modal
violations.failure: Modal cannot be closed with Escape key - only via button click. User is trapped.
steps_to_reproduce: Expected: Modal closes. Actual: Nothing happens
violations.current_code: role="dialog" aria-modal="true" - has focus trap but no Escape handler
violations.expected_behavior: Escape key should close modal and return focus to trigger element

violations.user_scenario: User with cognitive disability needs more time to read and evaluate claim
violations.failure: Timer auto-submits (forfeits) when time expires with NO way to pause or extend time during evaluation
steps_to_reproduce: Read claim slowly due to cognitive processing needs
Timer expires before user can formulate answer
violations.assistive_tech: Users with cognitive disabilities, dyslexia, or using translation tools
violations.expected_behavior: WCAG requires ability to turn off, adjust, or extend time limits. Pause button should work during timer, or time should extend on request.
violations.fix:
1. Allow pause button to work during claim evaluation (currently only shows during result phase)
2. Add "Request More Time" button that extends timer by 50% (WCAG 2.2.1 requirement)
3. Or: Make timer optional in settings for accessibility mode

violations.user_scenario: Screen reader user trying to enter player names
violations.failure: Player name inputs use aria-label instead of visible <label> elements - WCAG violation
steps_to_reproduce: Navigate to setup screen with NVDA
NVDA announces aria-label but there's no visible label
Users who need visual labels (low vision, cognitive) cannot see what field is for
violations.current_code:
<input
  aria-label="Player ${index + 1} first name"
  // NO visible label element
violations.expected_behavior: WCAG requires VISIBLE labels for all form inputs. aria-label alone is not sufficient.
violations.fix:
<label htmlFor={`player-${index}-first`} className="mono" style={{...}}>
  Player {index + 1} First Name
</label>
<input
  id={`player-${index}-first`}
  aria-label={`Player ${index + 1} first name`}
  />

violations.user_scenario: Screen reader user trying to search leaderboard
violations.failure: Search input has NO label at all - not even aria-label
steps_to_reproduce: Screen reader announces: 'Edit text, Search teams...' (only placeholder)
violations.current_code:
<input
  type="text"
  value={searchFilter}
  placeholder="Search teams..."
  // NO label or aria-label
violations.expected_behavior: Input must have associated label
violations.fix:
<label htmlFor="leaderboard-search" className="sr-only">Search teams</label>
<input
  id="leaderboard-search"
  type="text"
  aria-label="Search teams"
  />

style={{

  padding: '0.5rem 0.75rem',

violations.user_scenario: Screen reader user trying to expand "How to Play" section
violations.failure: Button toggles content but has NO aria-expanded attribute - screen reader users don't know if it's expanded or collapsed
steps_to_reproduce: Navigate to setup screen with JAWS
Tab back to button - still just says 'Button, HOW TO PLAY'
User has no idea if content is expanded or collapsed
violations.expected_behavior: Toggleable buttons must have aria-expanded
violations.fix:
<button
  onClick={() => setShowHowToPlay(!showHowToPlay)}
  aria-expanded={showHowToPlay}
  aria-controls="how-to-play-content"
  >
...
<div id="how-to-play-content" ...>

violations.user_scenario: Screen reader user submits answer and waits to hear if they were correct
violations.failure: Result screen appears but NO aria-live or role=status - screen reader doesn't announce result
steps_to_reproduce: NVDA: silence. User has to manually navigate to find out result.
This breaks the game flow completely for blind users
violations.current_code:
<div
  className="animate-in"
  style={{...}}
  // NO role or aria-live
violations.expected_behavior: Result must be announced immediately when it appears
violations.fix:
<div
  role="status"
  aria-live="assertive"
  aria-atomic="true"
  className="animate-in"
  >
  <div aria-label={`${resultData.correct ? 'Correct' : 'Incorrect'}. You earned ${resultData.points} points.`}>

violations.user_scenario: Screen reader user needs to know time remaining but timer only announces at 10 seconds
violations.failure: Timer has aria-live='assertive' when ‚â§10s but aria-live='off' otherwise - no periodic announcements
steps_to_reproduce: At 10s: JAWS suddenly announces every second
User had no idea how much time they had for most of the round
violations.expected_behavior: Timer should announce at key intervals (e.g., every 30s, then at 30s, 20s, 10s)
violations.fix:
1. Use aria-live='polite' always 2. Reduce update frequency: only update aria-label at strategic points 3. Or: Add separate announcement div that only updates at 90s, 60s, 30s, 10s: {[90, 60, 30, 10].includes(timeRemaining) && (
{Math.floor(timeRemaining / 60)} minutes {timeRemaining % 60} seconds remaining
)}

Actual: Focus stays on help button behind modal
Must Tab through entire modal content to reach close button
violations.current_code: role="dialog" but no focus management or keyboard handler
violations.expected_behavior: 1. Focus moves to modal on open. 2. Escape closes modal. 3. Focus returns to trigger on close.

violations.user_scenario: Colorblind user trying to determine if their score is positive or negative
violations.failure: Score uses ONLY color (green vs red) to indicate positive/negative - no text indicator
steps_to_reproduce: Play game as red-green colorblind user
Score shows '+15 PTS' in green or '-5 PTS' in red

violations.current_code:
color: score >= 0 ? 'var(--correct)' : 'var(--incorrect)'
// Only difference is color
violations.expected_behavior: Must not rely on color alone - need text, icon, or shape difference
violations.fix:
Add icon:

{score >= 0 ? '‚ñ≤' : '‚ñº'} {score >= 0 ? '+' : ''}{score} PTS

Or pattern:
background: score >= 0 
  ? 'linear-gradient(45deg, rgba(16, 185, 129, 0.15) 25%, transparent 25%)'
  : 'linear-gradient(45deg, rgba(239, 68, 68, 0.15) 25%, transparent 25%)'

violations.user_scenario: User accidentally clicks 'Exit & Discard Progress' instead of 'Continue Playing'
violations.failure: Destructive action (discard progress) has no confirmation - single click loses all progress
steps_to_reproduce: Game immediately exits - no second confirmation
violations.assistive_tech: All users, especially those with motor disabilities
violations.expected_behavior:
WCAG 3.3.4: For data deletion, one of:
1. Reversible (can undo)
2. Checked (validated before submitting)
3. Confirmed (require second confirmation)
violations.fix:
Current implementation DOES have confirmation (the modal itself).

But could improve:

Option 1 - Require typing 'EXIT':
const [confirmText, setConfirmText] = useState('');

<input
  value={confirmText}
  onChange={(e) => setConfirmText(e.target.value)}
  placeholder="Type EXIT to confirm"
/>
<button
  disabled={confirmText !== 'EXIT'}
  onClick={...}
>
  Exit & Discard Progress
</button>

Option 2 - Add checkbox:
const [confirmExit, setConfirmExit] = useState(false);

<label>
  <input type="checkbox" checked={confirmExit} onChange={(e) => setConfirmExit(e.target.checked)} />
  I understand I will lose all progress
</label>
<button disabled={!confirmExit}>Exit</button>
